2.74.text: It is human nature to want to be liked, loved and accepted.

7.38.text: However, if you worry too much about the opinion of others,

10.34.text: you run the real risk of being held hostage

12.56.text: and through fear, never becoming the person you were supposed to be.

17.02.text: And nothing scares me more than the thought that something so insignificant

21.26.text: can have such a significant impact over someone's life.

28.26.text: If you knew you are going to die tomorrow, would you really care

31.16.text: what people thought of your decisions today?

34.02.text: What if you knew you are gonna die in a week from now,

36.10.text: or a month from now, or 10 years, or 50 years?

41.02.text: So it's time to stop acting like you're gonna live forever.

48.06.text: It is your life, nobody else can tell you what's best for you,

51.94.text: and only you will have to deal with the consequences.

61.06.text: It is impossible to live up to everyone's expectations

64.04.text: and in doing so, you'll fail to please the most important person of all.

69.04.text: And the reality is, people usually don't care as much about you

74.36.text: There's a famous quote that that says we would worry less

77.38.text: about what other people think of us

78.66.text: if we realize how rarely they do.

81.50.text: As humans, we tend to live our life through our own ego

84.66.text: and unless something directly impacts us,

87.14.text: we don't care about it as much as we pretend to.

90.74.text: So it's time to stop caring about what others think,

93.14.text: because they probably don't care that much anyway.

95.94.text: Once you give up catering to other people's opinions,

98.64.text: you'll find your own happiness and discover who you truly are.

106.40.text: The single most powerful idea anyone looking to succeed

110.16.text: in anything: sports, career, fitness, finance or life, can embrace

114.72.text: is that success does not come from making a few

120.86.text: And in fact it's very much the opposite.

123.12.text: The truth is success happens when you make the smallest,

126.16.text: seemingly easiest, apparently most insignificant decisions

130.26.text: correctly, consistenly every day, for a long time.

135.14.text: Let me give you an example.

136.70.text: If you have a burger today, you won't be unhealthy tomorrow.

140.28.text: And in the moment, having one burger won't seem to matter.

143.20.text: In fact, it doesn't really matter.

145.84.text: And if you have a burger every single day this week,

148.28.text: you probably still won't be unhealthy.

151.44.text: But, in a year's time, after eating a burger every single day,

158.20.text: And you know, we all make thousands of tiny decisions

161.76.text: And these small decisions seem like they don't matter,

164.90.text: but in fact, they are all that matters.

168.22.text: And these small decisions compound over time

170.78.text: to define who you are right now.

172.76.text: And you are, right now, a product of the billions of

175.78.text: unimportant tiny decisions you have made in your life.

179.26.text: And this idea is called the 'Slight Edge', and right now,

181.84.text: when it comes to your health, finances, career, everything,

184.90.text: the 'Slight Edge' is either working for you or against you.

187.98.text: And you'll find out in a year.

189.56.text: And although it sounds simple to take control of these

192.88.text: of these small, easy decisions, the reality is,

195.00.text: things that are easy to do, are also very easy not to do.

201.06.text: If you genuinely want to improve and you're not just kidding yourself

204.04.text: as we all do, and if you want it bad enough,
